reviews.review_msg: He said the course was going to be about Britian at War. I took the class for my interest in Britian but all we talked about was some diarist from the 1940's. By far one of the worst classes I've taken. Taking notes is hard because mid lecture he will jump from topic to topic without distinction and be prepared for TONS of reading.

Pretty average class, but lack of clarity on homework is stressful. A lot of the material for the class topic is 20+ years old, so my major concern is the lack of updated materials she uses. Lots of readings too, and she unfortunately does not go over the main ideas well. In the beginning yes, but later on no. Expectations are high too.
